title: Matchsafe, "Quail and Floral Decoration", ca. 1886
markings: STERLING, illegible mark (possibly date symbol) stamped on front bezel; lion passant, anchor, G, 360 stamped on reverse bezel.
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Oval, with upper and lower of left and right sides cinched slightly, featuring raised decoration of a pair of quails and lily flowers, all framed by double band of petal-like ornament. Reverse features rooster and hen among floral decoration. Lid hinged on side. Striker incised on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, "Quail and Floral Decoration", ca. 1886.
ca. 1886. Silver. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1980-14-43.
